alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 4:38AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central North Carolina, including the following county, Surry. * WHEN...Until noon EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 436 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly along the Ararat and Fisher Rivers. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Ararat and Fisher Rivers is the most likely place to experience flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaver Creek, Beaverdam Creek, and Archies Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Airy... Fairview... Flat Rock... Dobson... Pilot Mountain... Bottom... White Plains... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
